exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 1 branch or a conjunctive pattern made of 2 patterns.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (n : nat) (R : naryRel n), isPRrel n R -> isPRrel n (notRel n R)

Premises:
Fin.R : forall n : nat, Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t (n + ?m) where ?m : [ |- nat]
naryRel = fix naryRel (n : nat) : Set := match n with | 0 => bool | S n0 => nat -> naryRel n0 end : nat -> Set Arguments naryRel _%nat_scope
notRel : forall n : nat, naryRel n -> naryRel n
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
isPRrel : forall n : nat, naryRel n -> Set
orRelPR : forall (n : nat) (R R' : naryRel n), isPRrel n R -> isPRrel n R' -> isPRrel n (orRel n R R')
andRelPR : forall (n : nat) (R R' : naryRel n), isPRrel n R -> isPRrel n R' -> isPRrel n (andRel n R R')
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
extEqualTrans : forall (n : nat) (a b c : naryFunc n), extEqual n a b -> extEqual n b c -> extEqual n a c
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (S n) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n), P n (VectorDef.cons ?A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S n)), P n v where ?A : [ |- Type]
orRel : forall n : nat, naryRel n -> naryRel n -> naryRel n
andRel : forall n : nat, naryRel n -> naryRel n -> naryRel n
pow_N : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.N -> R
pow_N_th : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> power_theory rI rmul req id_phi_N (pow_N rI rmul)
Eq_ext : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R), ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp eq
Rth_ARth : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
IDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp reqb (IDphi (R:=R))
charFunction : forall n : nat, naryRel n -> naryFunc n
triv_div_th : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> div_theory req cadd cmul phi (triv_div cO cI ceqb)
Ring_polynom.ring_rw_correct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe) (Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp cO cI ceqb phi get_sign l npe)
Pnat.SuccNat2Pos.inv : forall (n : nat) (p : BinNums.positive), BinPos.Pos.to_nat p = S n -> BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n = p
ssrbool.PackKeyedQualifier : forall (T : Type) (n : nat) (q : ssrbool.qualifier n T) (k : ssrbool.pred_key (T:=T) (ssrbool.has_quality n q)) (unkey_qualifier : ssrbool.qualifier n T), unkey_qualifier = q -> ssrbool.keyed_qualifier (q:=q) k
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
ssrbool.has_quality : forall (n : nat) (T : Type), ssrbool.qualifier n T -> ssrbool.pred_sort (ssrbool.predPredType T)
nat_case : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Prop), P 0 -> (forall m : nat, P (S m)) -> P n
lt_wf_rec : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Set), (forall n0 : nat, (forall m : nat, m < n0 -> P m) -> P n0) -> P n
gt_wf_rec : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Set), (forall n0 : nat, (forall m : nat, n0 > m -> P m) -> P n0) -> P n
ssrbool.KeyedQualifier : forall (T : Type) (n : nat) (q : ssrbool.qualifier n T) (k : ssrbool.pred_key (T:=T) (ssrbool.has_quality n q)), ssrbool.keyed_qualifier (q:=q) k

```coq
intros n R H.
unfold notRel, isPRrel.
destruct H as [H1 | H2].
- left; auto.
- right; auto.
Qed.
```

original: intros n R H. unfold notRel, isPRrel. destruct H as [H1 | H2]. - left; auto. - right; auto.
